definition: (of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa
to speak in defense of/to argue in favor of/to defend/to plead
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
to reply (to an accusation)/to defend one's dissertation
to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
to defend oneself/to rebut a charge
dialectics/dialectic or Socratic method of debate
to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself

pinyin: bian4 zheng4 wei2 wu4 zhu3 yi4

sentences.english: Advocacy can also take place outside the courtrooms, in arbitrations or in tribunals.
sentences.chinese: 除了法庭以外，仲裁或審裁中也有辯護髮生。

sentences.english: I want to argue with him but his logic is way too tight.
sentences.chinese: 我想跟他辯，但他的邏輯是滴水不漏。

sentences.english: Gimbel argued he was merely exercising his free speech rights.
sentences.chinese: 金貝爾辯解說他只是在實踐自己言論自由的權利而已。

sentences.english: I want to argue with him,but his logic is watertight.
sentences.chinese: 我想跟他辯，但他的邏輯是滴水不漏。

sentences.english: I intended to debate with him, but his arguments were so convincing.
sentences.chinese: 我想跟他辯，但他的邏輯是滴水不漏。

sentences.english: I have no reason and power to identify others right or wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我有什麼理由和權力，去辯識別人選擇的是與非？

sentences.english: A clean hand want no washing .
sentences.chinese: 淨手不用洗，無罪何須辯。

sentences.english: The twins are so much alike that we can hardly tell them apart.
sentences.chinese: 這對雙生子長得非常相像，我們幾乎辯認不出他們。

sentences.english: Certainly this is true for litigators.
sentences.chinese: 這對訟辯律師來說，無疑是對的。

definition: (conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
persons involved or implicated/party (to an affair)
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
